sn47.30:1.2: Now at that time the householder Mānadinna was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
sn47.30:1.5: “Sir, I’m not keeping well, I’m not alright. The pain is terrible and growing, not fading; its growing is evident, not its fading.
sn47.30:1.6: When I experience such painful feelings I meditate observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.30:1.7: I meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.30:1.9: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.30:1.10: And of the five lower fetters taught by the Buddha, I don’t see any that I haven’t given up.”
sn47.30:1.12: You have declared the fruit of non-return.”
